flow.descriptionCdata:
803ae9da-c9c6-4833-a7a4-e3e96c6eab83.4ffc118c-f87e-4460-baf1-fcb5cdfd196b.description=
This operation returns details of the specified flavor.

Inputs\:
    computeEndpoint - The compute endpoint to use for the request. 
Example\: https\://az-1.region-a.geo-1.compute.hpcloudsvc.com/v1.1/28400914814935
    flavorId - The flavor id to retrieve.
Example\: 100
    authToken - The authentication token to use for the request.
Example\: HPAuth_4f3b5044e4b05c3dbefdee82
    username - The username to use for authentication to the URL. For NTLM authentication, the required format is domain\user.
    password - The password to use for authentication to the URL.
    authType - The authentication type that this operation uses when trying to execute the request on the target server.
Valid values\: basic, form, digest, ntlm, kerberos, anonymous (no authentication).
Default value\: anonymous - authentication not used when executing the request.
    kerberosConfFile - The path to the Kerberos configuration file. If this input is empty the kdc (Key Distribution Center) and realm will get their values from the full domain name which is obtained from the url of the web server.
    timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A timeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
    socketTimeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for the data to be retrieved. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A socketTimeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
    useCookies - If true, enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: true.
    followRedirects - If true, the GET command automatically follows redirects. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: false.
    proxy - A proxy to use when accessing the web site.
    proxyPort - The port on the proxy to connect to.
    proxyUsername - The username to use when connecting to the proxy.
    proxyPassword - The password to use when connecting to the proxy.
    encodeURL - If true, automatically encodes the URL. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: false.
    userAgent - The value that should be used if the HTTP header USER_AGENT has to be overridden.
    characterSet - The character encoding that should be used for the HTTP Get request and response. 
Default value\: UTF-8.
    trustAllRoots - If true, enables weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted CA issued it.
Default value\: false.
    keystore - URL of the keystore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS client  authentication is not to be used.
    keystorePassword - Password to unlock the keystore.
    trustKeystore - URL of the truststore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS server authentication is not to be used.
    trustPassword - Password to unlock the truststore.
    headerNamesList - A list containing the names of headers that should be used for the request.
Example\: Accept,Content-Type
    headerValuesList - A list containing the values of headers that should be used for the request. 
Example\: text/plain,application/x-www-form-urlencoded
    queryNamesList - A list containing the names of query parameters that should be used for the request. 
Example\: parameterName1,parameterName2 
    queryValuesList - A list containing the values of query parameters that should be used for the request. 
Example\: parameterValue1,parameterValue2
    delimiter - A delimiter that separates the elements in the names and values lists.
Default value\:  (carriage return).

Results\:
    flavorDetails - A JSON array of objects describing a flavor. The JSON object contains the ID, name, ram, disk, vcpus and links for a flavor.

Responses\:
    success - The URL retrieved successfully.
    failure - The URL could not be retrieved.

Notes\:
See the HTTP Client Get operation for additional notes.
803ae9da-c9c6-4833-a7a4-e3e96c6eab83.7483fe20-a187-4343-be45-0fa0a436996e.description=
This flow lists the IDs, names and links for available flavors. The minDisk parameter can narrow the list of flavors to those which contain at least the specified number of gigabytes of disk storage. The minRam parameter narrows the list of flavors to those that contain at least the specified amount of RAM in megabytes. 

Inputs\:
    computeEndpoint - The compute endpoint to use for the request. 
Example\: https\://az-1.region-a.geo-1.compute.hpcloudsvc.com/v1.1/28400914814935
    authToken - The authentication token to use for the request.
Example\: HPAuth_4f3b5044e4b05c3dbefdee82
    username - The username to use for authentication to the URL. For NTLM authentication, the required format is domain\user.
    password - The password to use for authentication to the URL.
    authType - The authentication type that this operation uses when trying to execute the request on the target server.
Valid values\: basic, form, digest, ntlm, kerberos, anonymous (no authentication).
Default value\: anonymous - authentication not used when executing the request.
    kerberosConfFile - The path to the Kerberos configuration file. If this input is empty the kdc (Key Distribution Center) and realm will get their values from the full domain name which is obtained from the url of the web server.
    timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A timeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
    socketTimeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for the data to be retrieved. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A socketTimeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
    useCookies - If true, enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: true.
    followRedirects - If true, the GET command automatically follows redirects. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: false.
    proxy - A proxy to use when accessing the web site.
    proxyPort - The port on the proxy to connect to.
    proxyUsername - The username to use when connecting to the proxy.
    proxyPassword - The password to use when connecting to the proxy.
    encodeURL - If true, automatically encodes the URL. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: false.
    userAgent - The value that should be used if the HTTP header USER_AGENT has to be overridden.
    characterSet - The character encoding that should be used for the HTTP Get request and response. 
Default value\: UTF-8.
    trustAllRoots - If true, enables weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted CA issued it.
Default value\: false.
    keystore - URL of the keystore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS client  authentication is not to be used.
    keystorePassword - Password to unlock the keystore.
    trustKeystore - URL of the truststore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS server authentication is not to be used.
    trustPassword - Password to unlock the truststore.
    headerNamesList - A list containing the names of headers that should be used for the request.
Example\: Accept,Content-Type
    headerValuesList - A list containing the values of headers that should be used for the request. 
Example\: text/plain,application/x-www-form-urlencoded
    queryNamesList - A list containing the names of query parameters that should be used for the request. 
Example\: parameterName1,parameterName2 
Valid values\: minDisk,minRam,marker,limit
    queryValuesList - A list containing the values of query parameters that should be used for the request. The minDisk is in gigabytes and the minRam is in megabytes
Example\: parameterValue1,parameterValue2
    delimiter - A delimiter that separates the elements in the names and values lists.
Default value\:  (carriage return).

Results\:
    flavorList - A JSON array of objects describing flavors. The JSON object contains the IDs, names and links all available flavors.

Responses\:
    success - The URL retrieved successfully.
    failure - The URL could not be retrieved.

Notes\:
See the HTTP Client Get operation for additional notes.
803ae9da-c9c6-4833-a7a4-e3e96c6eab83.defefae1-f816-4e4c-99a1-e83b0f832b8a.description=Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null. 
Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - if the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - if some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
flow.name: Get Flavor Info

scriptlet.name: default
default
default
default
default
